sentences: Ta oli k천hn ja otsal천ppenud nagu kondibukett.
Sakslased sinusuguseid kondibukette ei tahagi, neil endil kodus samasuguseid hinge vaakumas k체ll ja k체ll.
translation: very thin, emaciated person or animal
context: The word 'tahagi' appears to be used in the context of describing very thin or emaciated people or animals. In the provided sentences, it's used metaphorically to compare a skinny person to a 'kondibukett' (emaciated bouquet/bundle) and suggests that Germans don't want such skinny types but have plenty of similar ones at home.
